thread.section_title: Mid-American Conference Sports News, Photos and Scores - cleveland.com
thread.title: Mount Union facing toughest test; John Carroll plays first home game
thread.title_full: Mount Union facing toughest test; John Carroll plays first home game | cleveland.com

author: Branson Wright, The Plain Dealer
title: Mount Union facing toughest test; John Carroll plays first home game
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- The Mount Union Purple Raiders (3-0) host Capital (2-1) at 7 p.m. on Saturday and the Crusaders are a threat to end the Raiders' three-game shutout streak.
The Raiders shut out Bethany, Muskingum and Marietta to start the season. The three straight shutouts to open a season are the most since a school-record four straight to open the 1935 season.
But now they face a Capital team that averages 36.7 points per game and 461 yards per game of total offense. It helps the Crusaders that they return nine starters on offense in their triple-option attack.
Capital averages 6.5 yards per rush. Brent Walton leads the OAC in rushing yards (172 per game) and rushing touchdowns (9). Sophomore slot Cory Heeter averages 7.9 yards per carry. Quarterback Nick Iske completes 54 percent of his passes.
But history is on Mount Union's side. The Raiders have won 29 straight against Capital. The Crusaders have not defeated the Raiders since 1987.
Online coverage: Live Stats, LIVE WDPN Audio, LIVE WRMU Audio.
John Carroll (3-0) will play its first home game of the season at 1:30 p.m. Saturday against Ohio Northern (2-1). Watch the live feed here. John Carroll is coming off a victory against Baldwin Wallace in last week's Cuyahoga Gold Bowl. Ohio Northern defeated Heidelberg.
Punter Kyle Rodriguez became the second John Carroll player in consecutive weeks to earn the OAC Special Teams Player of the Week. Rodriguez averaged 46.2 yards per punt on four punts in last week's victory. Because of Rodriguez's efforts, Baldwin Wallace's average field position was the 27-yard line.
Rodriguez also earned the honor for his punting performance against St. Vincent College last season.
Here are other games on Saturday involving Division II and Division III teams from Northeast Ohio:
Division II
Lake Erie College (1-3) at Ohio Dominican (2-2), 12:30 p.m., Live video Glenville State (3-1) at Notre Dame College (1-3), 12 p.m., Live stats Ashland (4-0) at Malone (0-4), 2 p.m., Live radio Division III
Baldwin-Wallace (1-2) at Muskingum (0-3), 1:30 p.m., Live video Hiram (0-3) at Wabash (3-0), 2 p.m., Live stats Allegheny (0-4) at Oberlin (1-3), 3 p.m., Live video Case Western Reserve (2-1) at Bethany (2-2), 2 p.m., Live stats
